title: Putin press conference: 'economy will rebound within two years' | World news | The Guardian
summary: putin says 'too early ' to say whether he will stand for president in 2018
putin responds to question on 'new cold war '
russia 's economic situation 'provoked by external factors '

text: vladimir putin said that russia 's economy would recover within two years .
he did not identify concrete measures but referred to the world 's need for energy increasing again as the global economy recovered and diversification of the economy in the interim .
he blamed external factors '' for problems with the economy and the ruble .
putin described sanctions against russia as illegitimate '' and said that saudi arabia and the us might '' have conspired to lower oil prices to harm russia ( and iran ) .
the russian president said that it was illogical to blame him for current frosty relations with the west .
referring to the number of us military bases around the world and its deployment of anti-ballistic missiles in europe , he asked how russia could possibly be seen as the aggressor .
he also compared nato expansion to the berlin wall .
he repeatedly said that he wanted a diplomatic solution to the crisis in ukraine .
putin said it must be solved by political means in line with fundamental international principles , including the right of self-determination .
putin said it was too early '' to decide whether he would run for president in 2018 .
we 're wrapping up our live coverage now - thanks for reading .
you can read shaun walker 's news wrap here .
a summary of the key points will follow shortly but in the meantime here are shaun 's thoughts : an odd press conference .
putin was on good form for parts and seemed to be enjoying himself , but he offered little concrete in the way of getting out of the crisis .
he said what we would expect on foreign policy , vigorously defending russia without being too hawkish .
there was space for some ty colourful metaphors and expressions .
his words are unlikely to terrify the market , but probably wo n't massively reassure it either .

it was pitched middle-of-the-road in all senses , there was lots of rhetoric but no major new policies announced , some conciliatory words about ukraine but nothing concrete , and the most difficult questions were ducked or avoided .
it was significantly shorter than last year ( 4hrs40 ) coming in at 3 hours and 10 minutes , but he still covered a lot of ground .

documents.title: putin says 'too early ' to say whether he will stand for president in 2018
text: last question .
putin is asked whether he will take responsibility for russia 's economic problems and whether he will run for president in 2018 .
putin says it is too early '' at present to decide whether he will run for president next time .
maybe we should have taken the economic decisions more expediently but the strategy by the central bank is adequate , says putin .
what we can be sure of is we will definitely overcome the period and difficulties and i am sure we will be stronger in the global economy .
he ends : thanks a lot for your attention .
happy new year .
there is a smattering of applause .
tom parfitt ( @ parfitt tom ) crimean tatar tv channel asks about draft law on rehabilitation of repressed peoples , why has it has stalled .
putin says it has n't .
tom parfitt ( @ parfitt tom ) crimean tatar tv channel asks about draft law on rehabilitation of repressed peoples , why has it has stalled .
putin says it has n't .
leonid ragozin ( @ leonidragozin ) journo from volgograd asks putin about @ twitterid law which bans cable channels from placing adverts .
putin totally dodges the answer .
the journalist pointed out that the law contradicts previous statements by putin talking about the need for an independent tv channel .
last three questions , declares putin .
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) that 's the three-hour mark .
a cameraman to my left just fell over .
do n't feel like we 're even close to the end .
a question about iran from an iranian business journal .
maybe someone should be appointed to boost turnover and trade with iran ?
there needs to be a change of ambassador .
you promised to visit iran and to sign a trade deal with iran but neither happened , i do n't understand , has there been a change of strategy ?
we will analyse the efficiency of our embassy in tehran but on the whole we are satisfied .
russia is taking steps to improve turnover with iran but it also depends on the global economy , says putin .
he references the fall in oil prices and says some people are talking about a conspiracy between saudi arabia and the us to harm iran and russia .
putin says : it might be [ true ] it might be . ''
the president says that it may be an attempt to put people off investment in shale , i.e .
to make it uneconomic .
russia is cooperating in machinery and aircraft construction , it is not just about energy , putin says .
referring to the trade deal mentioned by the questioner , the russian president says he believes they are very close to finding a solution .
a visit to tehran is quite possible and they are trying to agree on the timing and terms of it .
paul sonne ( @ paulsonne ) angry russian journalist : what about the people in your inner circle who are billionaires as russians live in poverty ?
are they 5th column ?

jack farchy ( @ jfarchy ) great question : `` some of your close colleagues live in palace `` ( putin said earlier : `` there ca n't be a palace coup , we have no palaces '' ) jack farchy ( @ jfarchy ) `` and last question , what is the salary of igor sechin ? ''
( applause ) sechin is considered one of putin 's closest allies .
courtney weaver ( @ courtneymoscow ) putin says sechin `` an effective manager '' and doing a good job .
says he does n't know how much $ $ he makes courtney weaver ( @ courtneymoscow ) putin says there are no government officials in my circle and i hope there will never be - they 're colleagues
a woman holding a green fluffy crocodile just asked about parking fines in moscow .
tom parfitt ( @ parfitt tom ) a woman clutching a toy gena the crocodile asks putin about parking in moscow .

missed what gena 's got to do with it here is what wikipedia says about gena the crocodile : gena the crocodilefriendly crocodile in the series of animation films gena the crocodile , cheburashka and shapoklyak by roman kachanov ( soyuzmultfilmstudio ) .
gena the crocodile made his debut in 1966 's novel gena the crocodile and his friends by eduard uspensky .
a question from the chechen leader 's press secretary .
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) alvi karimov , kadyrov 's press secretary is now asking a question .
bizarre .
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) `` ramzan akhmatovich has never broken the constitution '' calls ksenia sobchak `` naglaya '' for twisting facts .
how does press sec get to ask qs ?
question from the ft 's courtney weaver .
alec luhn ( @ asluhn ) good q whether yevtushenkov trial means change in rules for big biz .
putin does n't quite answer , but invites yevtushenkov to meeting w/him tom parfitt ( @ parfitt tom ) bashneft case does not mean reevaluation of privatisations , says putin .
russian billionaire vladimir yevtushenkov 's oil company , bashneft , has been nationalised and he was placed under house arrest although he was released on wednesday .

from the ft yevtushenkov 's star fell rapidly his autumn when he was placed under house arrest in connection with an investigation into sistema 's purchase of bashneft , which was privatised in 2003 and acquired by sistema a few years later .
in october , a moscow court gave the state permission to seize bashneft from sistema after ruling that the company 's privatisation deal had been illegal .
sistema declined to appeal against the ruling .
jack farchy ( @ jfarchy ) .
@ ft 's @ twitterid is first western newspaper to get a question .
actual news in # putin 's answer , now sistema share price up 80 %
next a journalist from xinhua asks about relations between russia and china .
china is our largest trade partner , it will grow further .
we have many common interests in the international arena , says putin , and together the two countries help stabilise the situation in today 's world .
paul sonne ( @ paulsonne ) putin : we < 3 < 3 china .
never any problems .
no problems , none .
asked a question about turkey by a turkish journalist , putin says turkey and russia have many interests that coincide .
james marson ( @ marson jr ) putin calls erdogan a `` strong guy '' courtney weaver ( @ courtneymoscow ) putin compares russia and turkey to france and germany .
used to be best of enemies , now best of friends
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) this is descending into farce .
man from kirov asks putin for help for supermarkets to stock the region 's local fermented bread drink ( kvas ) .
jack farchy ( @ jfarchy ) # putin : `` i do n't know whether coca-cola is a harmful drink many experts say it is .
the thing is we have our own national drinks . ''
daniel sandford ( @ bbcdaniels ) coca cola sales about to take a hit in russia putin says we will help you conquer your place under the sun in the russian market .
update : a tweet was deleted from this block as it referred to the man asking the question as being drunk .
it later emerged that he has had two strokes .
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) a journalist from voronezh says her aunt 's friend is curious if putin has time for a personal life .
as for your aunt everything is just fine do n't worry a dignitary from europe asked me do you have love ?
i have people who love me , everything is just fine , do n't worry .
tom parfitt ( @ parfitt tom ) everything is fine ( with my love life ) , putin says .
he 's still on good terms with his ex wife , lyudmila .
paul sonne ( @ paulsonne ) question from kazakhstan : will our mutual market turn into a mutual crisis ?
paul sonne ( @ paulsonne ) putin : because kazakhstan also an oil producer , also will see this negative economic environment .
daniel sandford ( @ bbcdaniels ) so basically president putin did not answer john simpson 's question as to whether he would pull back from a `` new cold war ''

documents.title: putin responds to question on 'new cold war '
text: a question from the bbc 's john simpson , the first in english .
putin requests headphones so he can understand the question .
western countries believe almost universally that there 's a new cold war and you 've decided to create that , says simpson .
there are daily manoeuvres by russian aircraft towards western airspace .
you must have decided to do that as well as the incursion into ukraine .
now you need help from the west because of your currency .
will you say you have no desire for a cold war and you will do what you can to sort out the stiuation in ukraine ?
the president says russia has contributed to tension but the only thing we 've done is defended our interests .
we are not attacking anyone , encroaching upon anyone else 's interests .
it is not the manoeuvres that provoke tension .
russian stopped strategic bomber flights in the early 90s but the us continued flights of aircraft with nuclear warheads .
who provoked who ?
we only have two military bases abroad in the interests of defending ourselves while the us have military bases all over the world , but it is russia that is being aggressive ?
the pentagon 's budget is 10 times that of russia 's defence spend but you are saying we are aggressive .
is that logical ?
does anyone listen to us at all ?
the us is employing its abms ( anti-ballistic missiles ) in europe on our borders and we are the ones pursuing an aggressive policy ?
i believe that we are right in the course of the ukrainian crisis and our western partners are wrong .
there have been sanctions introduced against russia in a completely illegitimate and illegal way .
we will work together if our partners want to cooperate with us .
putin is asked for details on the amnesty for those returning capital back to russia .
businesses can keep their capital abroad but register it , says the president .
there will be no criteria and no filters '' .
the government is developing the mechanisms at the moment .
it will also enable legalisation of capital hidden within russia , he says .
next question , from reuters , the first from western media , is how sure are you of your circle that you will have its support always .
how high are the risks of a coup d'etat in russia ?
putin says do not be afraid .
there can be no overthrow of palaces because there are no palaces .
the president says he has support on domestic and foreign policy from the people because they know he is acting in their overwhelming interests '' .
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) reuters : you blame things on external forces , but off record people even in your entourage , blame you .
putin : ( grinning ) give me their names !
paul sonne ( @ paulsonne ) putin : there are elite wines and elite resorts but no elite people .
the russian elite , says putin , are the peasants , ordinary workers , who bear the weight of the country on their shoulders .
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) here 's ksenia sobchak , asking a very important question about chechnya , kadyrov 's threats to target families of insurgents .
james marson ( @ marson jr ) sobchak asks about chechnya .
accuses kadyrov of suspending russian constitution there ramzan kadyrov is the chechen leader .
everyone must obey russian law , says putin .

he says that in the overwhelming majority of cases families of terrorists know about their relatives ' activities but that does not give the right to anyone to act in that manner , including the head of chechnya .
he says people who burned houses had their faces covered so they may have been people who acted on emotional comments '' by kadyrov , rather than people acting in an official capacity .
law enforcement agencies are looking into it .
he refers to methods of combatting terrorism elsewhere , mentioning israel , where they destroy the houses of terrorists ' families , and the us .
in america , torture was legalised .
do you believe that ?
paul sonne ( @ paulsonne ) first channel question : do n't you think russia was n't able to reap the benefits of the olym because of the tragedy in ukraine ?
paul sonne ( @ paulsonne ) putin on sochi : `` everything that we wanted to achieve , in terms of preparing and holding the olym we achieved .
we won the olym paul sonne ( @ paulsonne ) putin on ukraine : of course the olym ended against the backdrop of events in ukraine .
`` but we did n't do that .
we did n't cause the coup '' paul sonne ( @ paulsonne ) putin : everyone is vacationing in sochi .
it means that we in russia have created an analogous summer and winter resort .
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) putin says important to hold the world cup because will help get russians doing more sport and living longer .
putin is asked about russia 's former richest man mikhail khodorkovsky who the president surprisingly pardoned last year after he had spent more than a decade behind bars .
there is laughter as the questioner says that khodorkovsky said he would not take part in politics but recently said he wants to be president .
do you regret pardoning him ?
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) `` year ago you pardoned khodorkovsky , he promised no politics , now he wants to be president .
you regret it ? ''
a : `` president of which country ? ''
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) putin : i let him out of prison on humanitarian grounds , because his mother was ill .
mother is a sacred thing .
i dont regret it .
the moscow times ( @ moscowtimes ) ruble weakens as traders hear no major measures in putin 's speech # business
there is a question about a website for gifted children in russia that helps foster patriotism .
will there be state support for such incentives ?
we would like to invite you to us .
putin wishes the questioner every success in her endeavour .
of course we 'll try to support the projects of such dimensions i believe there will be special funds for gifted children for the entirety of their education .
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) putin now quoting lermontov , making cinema references , taking about fifth column .
he 's into classic putin cruise mode after shaky start
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) q : where does opposition finish and 5th column start ?
a : it 's v difficult to answer that .
i 'm being honest .
because the border is subtle .
next question is the number of hospital beds and staff , especially in moscow , is reducing , what is your attitude to that ?
putin says this is one of the fundamental aspects of our lives .
millions of people expect from us to ameliorate the problems in healthcare , we should focus on that and what we have to do to make the situation better .
we spend a lot on healthcare but it 's not very efficient we should work on high-tech components of medical systems .
the moscow government believes there have been 30 % more beds than needed and that costs money in terms of land , electricity .
that money could be better spent , says the president .
he believes the moscow government is taking steps in the right direction .
the currency market is a concern for millions of russians .
who are those people who speculate on the currency ?
can you name them ( putin said they must be dealt with '' earlier this month ) ?
why ca n't we overcome them ?
are we considering fixing the currency ?

kirit radia ( @ kiritradia ) putin says no plans to introduce capital controls , he calls them `` artificial limitations , '' on currency trading funds , our companies '' can be involved in speculation , the president says .
putin is asked about energy deals with china and turkey .
asia-pacific and turkey need new sources of energy , he replies .
why would we refuse them ?

shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) today 's animal-based metaphor : `` perhaps the russian bear should quietly eat berries & not chase piglets in the taiga '' shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) to finish that metaphor , putin 's point was that if the bear did quietly eat berries , west would chain it up and saw off its teeth ( really )
asked about the situation in east ukraine , putin says it must be solved by political means in line with fundamental international principles , including the right of self-determination .
without a doubt the president of the ukraine wants to reach a resolution but he is not the only person there , we have heard dignitaries say they want to wage war till the end .
the president says he believes that hostages , prisoners-of-war should be exchanged right now '' so people can find themselves at home before christmas , the new year .
there should be positive dynamics in implementing the minsk agreement , which agreed a ceasefire in eastern ukraine , says the president .
ukraine has to respect everyone in their territory , says putin .
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) rouble has fallen from 60-ish to 63 since putin started speaking
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) as i 've written , & some people have mocked , i 've heard from more than one official that sochi boycotts/critic had effect on crimea response .

asked whether russia 's current situation is a result of what is happening in crimea , putin replies with an analogy that i 'm afraid i 've slightly lost the thread off about a bear in woods and honey .
he also refers to the bear 's fangs being taken out and the bear being stuffed .
there 's a reference to nuclear deterrent in there .
he concludes : do we want our bear to just become a stuffed animal ?

shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) extraordinary extended russia as bear , which the west is trying to put on a chain and pull out its teeth metaphor kirit radia ( @ kiritradia ) putin says `` they '' want the `` bear '' to `` sit quietly and eat honey . ''
`` but they try to chain the bear and take out his fangs and claws ''
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) a man in a dill t-shirt asking putin a question about russian soldiers in ukraine .
hallucinatory .
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) he totally ignored it .
the whole problem ( and advantage ) of this format of course , is that journalists ca n't interrupt or follow up qs .

shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) putin laying into kiev govt , has so far totally dodged the question of russian soldiers fighting in ukraine , talking only of `` volunteers '' kirit radia ( @ kiritradia ) putin got a small applause from the press after his answer to ukraine question
next question is from ukraine asking about russia 's intervention in ukraine .
how many russian troops did you send there ?
how much weaponry did you send there ?
how many russian soldiers died there ?
what did you tell your mothers ?

kirit radia ( @ kiritradia ) ukrainian journalist asks putin how many troops he sent to ukraine and how many of them died putin says the commander-in-chief is responsible for the destiny of the troops .
all those who volunteer to take part in military action are not mercenaries .
what went on in the east of the country was a punitive operation '' but organised by ukraine .

the problem is that after the coup d'etat a forceful overthrow , instead of starting a political dialogue , the new authorities started using law enforcement officers , when that did n't work out they started using the army , when that did n't work out they started using other means , such as an economic blockade .
he says russia is committed to dialogue .
next question .
are we going to live in a divided world ?
putin , referring to the berlin wall says we are currently witnessing the building of new walls .
is n't nato expansion a wall , a virtual wall ?
he also refers to abm ( anti-ballistic missiles ) near our border .
we want our partners to understand that the best way is to stop building those walls and to build a united humanitarian space .
journalists are asked to keep their questions short so more can be heard of putin .
what do you think is happening to the country at the moment ?
the president stresses the need to create favourable economic conditions and a good business environment .
we have to stop using law enforcement agencies to punish everyone we do n't like .
the country must take practical actions and keep concentrating .
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) putin : we need more innovation , diversify economy regional development , stop using police/courts for business disputes well , yes .
vladimir putin speaks during his annual end-of-year news conference in moscow .
zmeyev/reuters
second question '' begins with a comment thanking putin for his optimism , the mood of russia depends on the president 's mood , says the questioner .
will be able to use the current crisis to restructure the economy ?
the main danger in russia is bureaucracy .
are you sure that your thoughts and decisions will be implemented ?
the president says we must have the right macroeconomic policy and reserves to give us optimism .
in our country bureaucracy is nothing compared to the european union .
bureaucracy is not the problem in our country , says putin .
we will have to face some difficulties and we 'll definitely have to confront some social issues but still we can benefit from the situation [ by diversifying the economy ] .
the first question is will there be a financial and economic crisis over the next two years ?
and what do you think of the criticism of the government .
the economic situation may improve earlier than two years , says putin .
the government and central bank are acting properly and correctly '' .
maybe they could have acted quicker , he admits .
why am i optimistic ?
because the economy will adjust to low fuel prices , the question is how long it will take .
in order to stabilise the national currency , we might squeeze up the ruble liquidity a bit .
kirit radia ( @ kiritradia ) putin says he would n't call this week 's ruble drop a `` crisis . ''

kirit radia ( @ kiritradia ) putin says russia should not `` waste '' its foreign currency reserves in defending the ruble shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) dam can nap safely mt @ twitterid # putin says govt /central bank `` as a whole '' acting adequately .
seems no one gon na get fired on live tv

documents.title: economy will rebound 'within two years '
text: our economy will overcome the current situation .
how long will it take ?
i believe about two years in the worst situation .
putin says the world 's energy needs will enable a return to growth but in the meantime repeats that russia must diversify .
it is unavoidable and imminent that the situation will become normal .
he says that that concludes his opening statement and the press conference unless there are any questions
putin refers to the low oil price and knock-on effect on gas prices .
says it is possible they could put further downward pressure on the rouble .
incidentally , investors , bankers and diplomats have said that they will all be watching this press conference closely .
russia 's political course is so tied up with what is going on inside putin 's head that the markets will be following his tone closely .
will we hear the angry , combative sabre-rattling putin or will he give a message that will reassure the markets ?

documents.title: russia 's economic situation 'provoked by external factors '
text: putin says mortality has fallen and the birth rate is up , which he says is a good thing .
we have paid a lot of time this year to increasing the combat capacity of our forces .
the main question which is of interest to our citizens today is the economy and the currency and i will try to describe the situation .
of course , this situation has been provoked by external factors , first and foremost .
but the president adds that not enough has been done by russia to diversify the economy over the past two decades .
the president walks on stage to light applause .
he is reeling off economic figures .
the level of unemployment is quite low as you know this year we had a record harvest despite all the turbulence on the financial markets incomes will be higher than spending .

alec luhn ( @ asluhn ) ukrainian agency correspondent is wearing a sweatshirt with the `` dill '' sign that became popular during conflict ukrainian soldiers have been wearing shoulder patches showing a sprig of dill - an unofficial ensign adopted as a symbol of resistance .
welcome to our live coverage of vladimir putin 's annual press conference .
we 're expecting russia 's currency crisis and the economic fallout to dominate .
our moscow correspondent shaun walker will be filing from the scene throughout the morning .
here is his introduction : i 'm in the hall for putin 's press conference , having gone through three layers of security .
there are 1259 journalists accredited for the event , many of them from small regional publications , and the entire foreign press corps in moscow is also here .
the way it works is that putin 's spokesman dmitry peskov will on journalists to ask questions that have been arranged with the kremlin in advance .

towards the end of the session , putin himself takes over and people at random , hence the regional journalists who have bought hand-painted signs and other objects in the hope of attracting the president 's attention ( and hence the ban on furry toys ) .
last year putin went on for four hours and 40 minutes ( lucky we are not allowed to take any water in ) , and even then he was not finished .
as he left the stage , he was accosted by a ( probably planted ) question about mikhail khodorkovsky , formerly russia 's richest man who had spent ten years in jail .
putin , away from the cameras , made the surprise announcement that khodorkovsky could go free , and within 24 hours the former oligarch had left prison and been flown to germany .
usually , he waxes lyrical on all kinds of subjects .

there are usually a couple of tricky questions , but the beauty of the format is that he never has to face a follow-up question , and putin is good at batting away the one-off tough questions with fruity rhetoric .
how an imaginary paxman v putin interview would look , we will never know , sadly .
the obvious topic on everyone 's minds right now is the falling rouble .
the currency has stabilised in the past 24 hours after a dramatic fall on tuesday , but the currency is still down nearly 50 % on the start of the year .
other obvious to are the annexation of crimea in march and subsequent war in east ukraine .

we can expect at least one question from a local crimean journalist , but it is probably less likely that anyone will get the chance to properly put the evidence to putin that the russian army was involved in the fighting in east ukraine , and ask why he does n't just admit it .

Putin responds to question on 'new cold war'

Russia's economic situation 'provoked by external factors'

bulletin.text: President blames 'external factors' for Russia's economic problems and describes sanctions as illegitimate.
